intro: Hamularia, commonly known as the stickyweed, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its aromatic leaves and small, clustered flowers that often have a distinctive coloration. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate regions and is known for its sticky secretions on its leaves and stems. Hamularia species are often found in woodland areas and along stream banks. These plants have been used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
